gui.common
Class View

java.lang.Object
  java.awt.Component
      java.awt.Container
          javax.swing.JComponent
              javax.swing.JPanel
                  gui.common.View
All Implemented Interfaces:
IView, java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible
Direct Known Subclasses:
DialogView, InventoryView
public abstract class View
extends javax.swing.JPanel
implements IView

View is a base class that provides common functionality required by all views in the program (i.e., view classes extend View instead of JPanel).

The functionality provided by View to its subclasses includes:

  • A reference to the owning GUI object
  • A reference to the view's controller
  • A facility for turning off event notifications when user interface components are being programmatically updated
  • Methods for displaying various types of messages to users
  • Utility methods for creating fonts, borders, and other UI objects.
  • An abstract method interface that must be supported by all subclasses
  • A template method that defines a standard algorithm for constructing subclass instances

Subclasses should override the following methods:

  • createComponents
  • layoutComponents

Subclasses should also call construct from their constructors. Subclass constructors should also initialize the view's controller;

See Also:
Serialized Form
